net.truelicense.api

Interface LicenseManagementContextBuilder

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Builder<LicenseManagementContext>

    public interface LicenseManagementContextBuilder
extends Builder<LicenseManagementContext>
    A builder for license management contexts. Call its Builder.build() method to obtain the configured license management context.

    Clients should not implement this interface because it's subject to expansion in future minor version updates.

    Author:
    Christian Schlichtherle

      • initializationComposition

        LicenseManagementContextBuilder initializationComposition(LicenseFunctionComposition composition)
        Sets the composition of the custom license initialization and the built-in license initialization (optional). This property is ignored if no custom license initialization is set. Otherwise, if this method is not called, then LicenseFunctionComposition.decorate is used.
        Returns:
        this
        See Also:
        initialization(LicenseInitialization)

      • subject

        LicenseManagementContextBuilder subject(String subject)
        Sets the license subject. The provided string should get computed on demand from an obfuscated form, e.g. by annotating a constant string value with the @net.truelicense.obfuscate.Obfuscate annotation and processing it with the TrueLicense Maven Plugin.
        Parameters:
        subject - the license subject, i.e. a product name with an optional version range, e.g. MyApp 1.
        Returns:
        this

      • validation

        LicenseManagementContextBuilder validation(LicenseValidation validation)
        Sets the custom license validation (optional).
        Returns:
        this
        See Also:
        validationComposition(LicenseFunctionComposition)

      • validationComposition

        LicenseManagementContextBuilder validationComposition(LicenseFunctionComposition composition)
        Sets the composition of the custom license validation and the built-in license validation (optional). This property is ignored if no custom license validation is set. Otherwise, if this method is not called, then LicenseFunctionComposition.decorate is used.
        Returns:
        this
        See Also:
        validation(LicenseValidation)
